context: At last this greedy and selfish old woman put down the box by the wayside and opened it carefully, expecting to gloat her eyes on a mine of wealth. What she saw, however, so terrified her that she nearly lost her senses. As soon as she lifted the lid, a number of horrible and frightful looking demons bounced out of the box and surrounded her as if they intended to kill her. Not even in nightmares had she ever seen such horrible creatures as her much-coveted box contained. A demon with one huge eye right in the middle of its forehead came and glared at her, monsters with gaping mouths looked as if they would devour her, a huge snake coiled and hissed about her, and a big frog hopped and croaked towards her.  The old woman had never been so frightened in her life, and ran from the spot as fast as her quaking legs would carry her, glad to escape alive. When she reached home she fell to the floor and told her husband with tears all that had happened to her, and how she had been nearly killed by the demons in the box.

context: Then she began to blame the sparrow, but the old man stopped her at once, saying:  "Don't blame the sparrow, it is your wickedness which has at last met with its reward. I only hope this may be a lesson to you in the future!"  The old woman said nothing more, and from that day she repented of her cross, unkind ways, and by degrees became a good old woman, so that her husband hardly knew her to be the same person, and they spent their last days together happily, free from want or care, spending carefully the treasure the old man had received from his pet, the tongue-cut sparrow.

context: Once upon a time there was a man and his wife and they had a ring ofgold. It was a lucky ring, and whoever owned it always had enough tolive on. But this they did not know, and hence sold the ring for asmall sum. But no sooner was the ring gone than they began to growpoorer and poorer, and at last did not know when they would get theirnext meal. They had a dog and a cat, and these had to go hungry aswell. Then the two animals took counsel together as to how they mightrestore to their owners their former good fortune. At length the doghit upon an idea.

context: "They must have the ring back again," he said to the cat.The cat answered: "The ring has been carefully locked up in thechest, where no one can get at it.""You must catch a mouse," said the dog, "and the mouse must gnaw ahole in the chest and fetch out the ring. And if she does not want to,say that you will bite her to death, and you will see that she will doit."This advice pleased the cat, and she caught a mouse. Then she wantedto go to the house in which stood the chest, and the dog came after.They came to a broad river. And since the cat could not swim, the dogtook her on his back and swam across with her. Then the cat carriedthe mouse to the house in which the chest stood. The mouse gnawed ahole in the chest, and fetched out the ring. The cat put the ring inher mouth and went back to the river, where the dog was waiting forher, and swam across with her. Then they started out together forhome, in order to bring the lucky ring to their master and mistress.But the dog could only run along the ground; when there was a house inthe way he always had to go around it. The cat, however, quicklyclimbed over the roof, and so she reached home long before the dog,and brought the ring to her master.Then her master said to his wife: "What a good creature the cat is! Wewill always give her enough to eat and care for her as though she wereour own child!"But when the dog came home they beat him and scolded him, because hehad not helped to bring home the ring again. And the cat sat by thefireplace, purred and said never a word. Then the dog grew angry atthe cat, because she had robbed him of his reward, and when he saw herhe chased her and tried to seize her.And ever since that day cat and dog are enemies.

qas.question: What will happen when the cat tries to get the ring back?
qas.answer: She will successfully get the ring. .

abstract_70: A dog and cat were tasked with retrieving a ring that needed to be returned. The dog told the cat that the ring was locked securely in a chest where no one could access it. He suggested that the cat catch a mouse and make it gnaw through the chest to fetch the ring, threatening the mouse if necessary. The cat liked this plan and caught a mouse. To reach the house with the chest, they had to cross a broad river. Since the cat couldn't swim, the dog carried her across on his back. At the house, the mouse gnawed a hole in the chest and retrieved the ring, which the cat carried in her mouth. They began their journey home, but their different traveling methods caused a problem - the dog had to run around buildings on the ground, while the cat could quickly climb over roofs. This allowed the cat to arrive home first and deliver the ring to their master. The master praised the cat greatly, promising to always feed and care for her like their own child. However, when the dog finally arrived, he was scolded and beaten for not helping to bring the ring home. The cat sat quietly by the fireplace, purring without saying a word. This unfair treatment angered the dog, who felt the cat had stolen his reward, and from that day forward, he would chase and try to catch the cat whenever he saw her. This incident marked the beginning of the eternal enmity between cats and dogs.
abstract_30: A dog and cat worked together to retrieve a valuable ring locked in a chest. The dog advised the cat to use a mouse to gnaw through the chest, and helped the cat cross a river since she couldn't swim. After successfully obtaining the ring, they headed home by different routes - the dog running around obstacles on the ground while the cat climbed over roofs. The cat arrived first and delivered the ring, earning praise and rewards from their masters. The dog, arriving later, was scolded and beaten. Feeling cheated of his recognition, the dog became angry at the cat, leading to the eternal enmity between cats and dogs.

Meanwhile, the dog is punished for seemingly not helping, leading to a lifelong enmity between the cat and the dog.

context: This advice pleased the cat, and she caught a mouse. Then she wantedto go to the house in which stood the chest, and the dog came after.They came to a broad river. And since the cat could not swim, the dogtook her on his back and swam across with her. Then the cat carriedthe mouse to the house in which the chest stood. The mouse gnawed ahole in the chest, and fetched out the ring. The cat put the ring inher mouth and went back to the river, where the dog was waiting forher, and swam across with her. Then they started out together forhome, in order to bring the lucky ring to their master and mistress.But the dog could only run along the ground; when there was a house inthe way he always had to go around it. The cat, however, quicklyclimbed over the roof, and so she reached home long before the dog,and brought the ring to her master.

context: Then her master said to his wife: "What a good creature the cat is! He began chasing and trying to catch her, which established the lasting enmity between cats and dogs.

abstract_70: A cat caught a mouse and sought help from a dog to reach a house containing a chest. Since the cat couldn't swim, the dog carried her across a river. At the house, the mouse gnawed a hole in the chest to retrieve a ring, which the cat took in her mouth. The dog helped the cat cross the river again, and they began their journey home. While the dog had to go around houses, the cat could climb over roofs, allowing her to arrive home first and deliver the ring to their master. The master praised the cat, promising to care for her like their own child. However, when the dog arrived, he was beaten and scolded. The cat, sitting by the fireplace, remained silent. Angered by losing his reward, the dog began chasing the cat, establishing their lasting enmity.
abstract_30: A cat and dog collaborated to retrieve a ring across a river, with the dog helping the cat swim. The cat, using a mouse's help, got the ring and returned home faster by climbing over roofs while the dog had to go around buildings. The cat received praise while the dog was scolded, leading to the eternal rivalry between cats and dogs.
fully_response: The owners didn't know the dog helped because the cat returned home first with the ring and didn't tell them about the dog's assistance. The dog's delay and the cat's silence led the owners to believe the cat acted alone.

The dog was delayed and only arrived later, so the owners assumed he hadn't contributed.

context: Once upon a time there was a man and his wife and they had a ring ofgold. It was a lucky ring, and whoever owned it always had enough tolive on. But this they did not know, and hence sold the ring for asmall sum. But no sooner was the ring gone than they began to growpoorer and poorer, and at last did not know when they would get theirnext meal. They had a dog and a cat, and these had to go hungry aswell. Then the two animals took counsel together as to how they mightrestore to their owners their former good fortune. At length the doghit upon an idea.Then her master said to his wife: "What a good creature the cat is! Wewill always give her enough to eat and care for her as though she wereour own child!"But when the dog came home they beat him and scolded him, because hehad not helped to bring home the ring again. And the cat sat by thefireplace, purred and said never a word. Then the dog grew angry atthe cat, because she had robbed him of his reward, and when he saw herhe chased her and tried to seize her.And ever since that day cat and dog are enemies.

qas.question: Why were the cat and dog enemies?
qas.answer: The cat took the credit for retrieving the ring. .

abstract_70: A man and his wife owned a magical gold ring that provided them with a good living, though they were unaware of its power and sold it cheaply. After selling the ring, they fell into poverty, leaving both them and their pets - a dog and a cat - struggling for food. The animals discussed how to restore their owners' fortune, and the dog devised a plan. When the situation was resolved, the master promised to always care for the cat like their own child, while the dog was beaten for not helping to retrieve the ring. The cat sat silently purring by the fireplace, which angered the dog who felt cheated of his reward. From that day forward, whenever the dog saw the cat, he would chase her, establishing the lasting enmity between cats and dogs.
abstract_30: A married couple possessed a lucky gold ring that ensured their livelihood, but unknowingly sold it, leading to their poverty. Their pets, a dog and cat, decided to help restore their fortune. After a series of events, the cat managed to retrieve the ring, earning the owners' affection, while the dog was punished for seemingly not helping. This incident sparked the eternal enmity between cats and dogs.
fully_response: The cat and dog became enemies because the cat took all the credit for retrieving the lucky ring, causing the owners to reward her while scolding the dog. The dog, feeling cheated and angry, chased the cat, leading to a lasting feud between them.
roughly_response: The cat and dog became enemies because the cat took all the credit for retrieving the lucky ring, leading the owners to praise and care for her while scolding and beating the dog. The dog grew angry at the cat for stealing his reward, and from then on, he chased her whenever he saw her.
abstract_response: The dog and cat became enemies because the dog was beaten for not helping retrieve the magical gold ring, while the cat was praised and cared for by the master. The dog felt cheated of his reward and, out of anger, chased the cat whenever he saw her, establishing their lasting enmity.
partially_response: The cat and dog became enemies because the cat successfully retrieved the lost gold ring, earning the owners' affection, while the dog was punished for appearing not to help. This incident created lasting animosity between them.
